summary: The concept of "international volunteer," which redirects to the preferred term "international voluntary worker," pertains to individuals who engage in voluntary service across borders, contributing to various cooperation policies within the EU framework. These workers often participate in initiatives aimed at fostering solidarity, social inclusion, and development aid. The EU recognizes the significance of international voluntary workers in enhancing cultural exchange and promoting civic engagement, thereby reinforcing its commitment to cooperation policy. Legal and regulatory documents related to this concept emphasize the need for structured support and recognition of the contributions made by these individuals in achieving broader EU objectives.
